{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3750484,"name":"Arnaud Girard","username":"Arnaud_Girard","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/db5fbb/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-09-28T18:02:27.586Z","cooked":"

We had a big issue with the SystemCore communication. The issue is that sometimes, when the SystemCore loses wifi connection with the Driver Station, it stays enabled and keeps the last joystick input. We use the integrated access point of the SystemCore. Combined with the fact that the SystemCore often loses communication, it makes the issues really DANGEROUS. Please be cautious!!!

Here is a fix you can put in the robotPeriodic

if (DriverStation.getAlliance().isEmpty()) {

throw new IllegalArgumentException("No DS connected");

}

Here is the link to the github issue : GitHub · Where software is built

Please make an issue on the systemcore repo. It should be timing out after 125ms unconditionally.

Also, that get alliance thing won’t work, because that only is empty before a DS connects the first time. It never goes back to empty after the DS connects.

Additionally, what motors are you using. And controlled over CAN or PWM? And what SystemCore OS image and wpilib version?

We are currently writing an issue right now in the systemcore repo. As for the 125ms it does not appear to work in this case as if you look at the video I posted it stays enabled for more than 1 sec.

Does it ever stop? 125ms should be a watchdog timeout, and then 5 seconds should be a full DS disconnect. If you want to be a bit safer, disconnect your motors and keep the camera on the RSL. If that stays blinking, its still enabled.

Also make sure the post includes wpilib version, systemcore version, and if possible your code.

It depends as sometimes the systemcore stays enabled for more than 6-7 sec and only stops when we manually stop the robot with the main breaker but sometimes it automaticly disables before 5 sec. Also if you check the video the rsl is still blinking which is why I think it is a systemcore problem and not a motor one.

Does it happen with another laptop? I wonder if your laptop is doing something weird where its only disabling one direction of the WiFi. Not what I would expect at all, but through lots of testing we’ve never seen this so just want to remove all variables.

We will test on another laptop with newly installed wpilib 2027 software.
Afterwards we will post our findings.
Also this is the issue we posted on github if more information is needed please comment on the issue :

github.com/wpilibsuite/SystemCoreTesting

SystemCore Dangerous Communication Error

opened 06:30PM - 28 Sep 25 UTC
Raphdf201

We had a big issue with the SystemCore communication. The issue is that sometime…s, when the SystemCore loses wifi connection with the Driver Station, it stays enabled and keeps the last joystick input. We use the integrated access point of the SystemCore. Combined with the fact that the SystemCore often loses communication, it makes the issues really DANGEROUS. Please be cautious!!! [ChiefDelphi post](https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/systemcore-dangerous-communication-error/506661) [Video](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Y0MgkbtdVcWvYA65F1WJLUjf1r0AOIBb/view) Motors : Kraken x60 with firmware 25.90.0.0 Vendordeps : Phoenix6 25.90.0-alpha-1 PathplannerLib 2027.0.0-alpha-2 WPILib-New-Commands 1.0.0 DS: 25.0 Systemcore version : limelightosr-alpha-6 WPILib version : 2027_alpha1 WiFi settings <img width="1289" height="308" alt="WiFi settings" src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2c03c540-4659-443c-b3e7-4f8f8784dc2c" />

I posted a reply on GitHub, but figured I should reply here too. We root caused the issue, and it can happen on any Alpha OS image. We’re working on a fix, but for now please be careful. Only disconnects are affected, proper disables will work.
